contest-event.event-date:
Sept. 5, 1942 D British Open
British Open 1 Test Piece Contest
british-open
Own Choice from a Specified List
Lorenzo
Belle Vue, Manchester, Greater Manchester, England, UK James Brier was appointed referee. The bands who performed "Pageantry" did not have to perform the second movement, "Cortege". Prizes: - 1st: 50 plus 2000 Gold Trophy plus the "Sunday Chronicle" Trophy, 2nd: 20, 3rd: 12, 4th: 8, 5th: 6, 6th: 4 A Gold Medal valued at 2 Guineas was presented to each top six band. 17 bands competed
The winning band gave a short concert after the presentation of the prizes, that included a selection of their own choice and a hymn tune as well as a BBC broadcast on the 26th September.
At the end of the contest, Miss Gracie Cole, winner of the Alexander Owen Memorial Scholorship played a solo with Grimethorpe Colliery Band.
May 10, 2010, 1:26 p.m. Jan. 30, 2019, 11 a.m.
